ingredients: Optional toppings: fried egg, sliced cucumber, chopped scallions
instructions: Heat vegetable oil in a large pan or wok over medium heat...
Add chopped onion and minced garlic, and saut√© until fragrant...
Add diced chicken to the pan and cook until it turns golden brown...
Add shrimp and mixed vegetables, and stir-fry until cooked through...
Push the ingredients to one side of the pan and pour beaten eggs into the empty space...
Add cooked rice to the pan and stir well to combine with the other ingredients...
Season with kecap manis and soy sauce according to your taste...
Continue stir-frying for a few more minutes until the rice is heated through...
Remove from heat and serve hot...
Optionally, top with a fried egg, sliced cucumber, and chopped scallions...
Heat vegetable oil in a large pot over medium heat...
Add chopped shallots, minced garlic, grated galangal, and bruised lemongrass...
Add the beef chunks to the pot and cook until browned on all sides...
In a separate bowl, mix together tamarind paste, ground turmeric, ground coriander, ground cumin, chili paste, salt, and sugar with a little water to form a paste...
Add the spice paste to the pot and stir well to coat the beef...
Pour in coconut milk, add kaffir lime leaves, and bring the mixture to a simmer...
Reduce the heat to low and let it simmer, covered, for several hours until the beef is tender and the sauce has thickened...
Adjust the seasoning with salt and sugar according to your taste...
Once the beef is tender and the sauce has thickened to your liking, remove from heat and serve hot with steamed rice...

ingredients: Assorted vegetables (cabbage, bean sprouts, green beans, carrots, etc.)
instructions: Boil or steam the vegetables until crisp-tender...
Arrange the boiled vegetables, fried tofu, boiled potatoes, hard-boiled eggs, and cucumber on a plate...
Pour peanut sauce over the vegetables and garnish with shrimp crackers...
Serve immediately and enjoy...
In a blender, combine soy sauce, lime juice, garlic, ginger, candlenuts, coriander seeds, turmeric powder, brown sugar, and salt...
Blend until you get a smooth marinade...
Cut chicken breast into small cubes and marinate in the sauce for at least 1 hour, or overnight in the refrigerator...
Thread the marinated chicken onto skewers...
Grill the skewers over medium heat, turning occasionally, until the chicken is cooked through and slightly charred...
Serve hot with peanut sauce and rice or as a side dish...
Boil chicken in a pot of water until fully cooked...
Remove the chicken from the pot and let it cool. Shred the meat and set aside...
In the same pot, add chicken broth, lemongrass, kaffir lime leaves, galangal, garlic, turmeric, candlenuts, coriander seeds, cumin, white pepper, and salt...
Simmer the broth over low heat for about 30 minutes to let the flavors meld...
Strain the broth and discard the solids...
Prepare bowls with cooked rice vermicelli, shredded chicken, bean sprouts, fried shallots, and hard-boiled eggs...
Pour the hot broth over the ingredients in the bowls...
Garnish with a squeeze of lime juice and serve hot...
In a food processor, blend together beef or chicken, garlic, salt, white pepper, and tapioca flour until well combined...
Add ice cubes and continue blending until the mixture becomes smooth and sticky...
Transfer the mixture to a bowl and mix in an egg...
Bring a pot of water to a boil...
Using wet hands, shape the meat mixture into small balls and drop them into the boiling water...
Cook the meatballs until they float to the surface, then remove them from the pot and set aside...
In another pot, bring chicken broth to a boil...
Cook egg noodles according to package instructions...
In serving bowls, add cooked egg noodles, bok choy, and meatballs...
Pour hot chicken broth over the ingredients...
Garnish with fried shallots and serve with sweet soy sauce and chili sauce...
